com swish scarf p 3 tan i s notes * brioche knitting uses all the same knit stitches and manoeuvres as regular knitting but in two colour brioche every row is knit twice once with each colour and the language and stitch abbreviations can take a little getting used to once you ve worked through a few row of this scarf you ll have the basics down and will be off to the races * when counting your stitches in brioche remember that slipped stitches and their yo s count as 1 stitch * one trip across the needle = one row you will work 1 row with mc slide the stitches to the opposite end of the needle and work the next row in cc then you will turn your work and work 1 row with mc slide stitches to the opposite end of the needle and work the next row with cc you are always sliding stitches after working an mc row and turning after a cc row * this pattern is easily modified to work with any weight of yarn cast on an odd number of stitches and go forth you will need to adjust needle size and yardage accordingly instructions cast on option 1# cast on 39 stitches using larger needle and long tail cast on method continue to scarf body instructions cast on option #2 i-cord cast on using main colour and larger circumference needle and long tail cast on method cast on 3 stitches row 1 knit do not turn slip 3 stitches just knit back to left hand needle the working yarn is still on the left end of the stitches and the stitches are lined up and ready to be knit off of the right end pull working yarn tight around the back to knit the first stitch it s a normal knit row the only odd thing is that the yarn is coming from the far left rather than the right repeat these two steps knitting and then slipping the just knit stitches back to the left hand needle 33 times with 3 stitches on your needle turn work 90 degrees and pick up 33 stitches along edge of icord then pick up 3 stitches from cast on edge 39 stitches on needle continue to scarf body instructions © tanis fiber arts
